question.name: Question 1
question.text: A terrorist act can include threats to commit prohibited acts. True or false?

question.name: Question 2
question.text: Complete the sentence. For an act to be a terrorist act, it must cause or be likely to cause\u2026
question.choices: \u2026 serious risk to the health and safety of the public|\u2026 serious damage to property |\u2026 serious disruption or destruction of critical infrastructure such as the water supply|Any of the above

question.name: Question 3
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an offence?
question.correctans: Collecting information on terrorist acts for academic purposes
question.choices: Collecting or making documents likely to cause terrorist acts|Providing or receiving training connected with terrorist acts|Possessing things connected with terrorist acts|Collecting information on terrorist acts for academic purposes

question.name: Question 4
question.text: Complete the sentence. An organisation is a terrorist organisation\u2026
question.correctans: \u2026 if a court finds that it is either directly or indirectly engaged in preparing, planning or assisting in the doing of a terrorist act
question.choices: \u2026 if a court finds that it is either directly or indirectly engaged in preparing, planning or assisting in the doing of a terrorist act|\u2026 only if it directly engages in planning, preparing or assisting in the doing of a terrorist act only|\u2026 if it unknowingly receives funds from a terrorist organisation, even if it had no way of knowing that it was doing so|\u2026 only if it has been blacklisted by the government

question.name: Question 5
question.text: Fill in the blank. It is an offence to ____ a terrorist organisation.
question.choices: \u2026 provide support and resources to \u2026|\u2026 acquire funds from or for \u2026|\u2026 associate with \u2026|All of the above

question.name: Question 6
question.text: You will be committing an offence if you recklessly receive funds from a terrorist organisation, even if the organisation is not listed as a terrorist organisation by the government. True or false?

question.name: Question 7
question.text: Which of the following is a source of money for terrorists?
question.choices: Commercial enterprises|State sponsors|Contributions |All of the above

question.name: Question 8
question.text: What is NOT true regarding the financing of terrorist organisations?
question.correctans: Terrorist organisations finance their operations exclusively through commercial enterprises
question.choices: Contributions to terrorist organisations can come from charities and religious organisations|Terrorist organisations may operate legitimate businesses to generate profit to finance their activities|There is evidence that other countries have been involved in supporting terrorist organisations|Terrorist organisations finance their operations exclusively through commercial enterprises

question.name: Question 9
question.text: Why is terrorist financing described as reverse money laundering?
question.correctans: Because it can involve legitimate funds being made available to terrorists for use in criminal activity
question.choices: Because laundered money is often used to finance terrorist activities|Because it can involve legitimate funds being made available to terrorists for use in criminal activity|Because terrorism generates revenue that can be used in money laundering|Because laundered money cannot be used to finance terrorism

question.name: Question 10
question.text: If terrorists rely on the proceeds of crime to finance their activities, they will often need to engage in money laundering. True or false?

question.name: Question 11
question.text: Choose the best answer. Which money laundering technique can also be used in terrorist financing?
question.choices: Structuring|Smuggling of high value items|Corporate financing techniques|All of the above

question.name: Question 12
question.text: How can you avoid being charged for being "reckless"?
question.correctans: By checking both the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade blacklist and the Criminal Code Regulations blacklist
question.choices: By checking the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade blacklist|By checking the Criminal Code Regulations blacklist of terrorist organisations|By checking both the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade blacklist and the Criminal Code Regulations blacklist|By engaging a private investigator to monitor an organisation before giving it funds

question.name: Question 13
question.text: It will be an offence for you or your organisation to deal with money if \u2026
question.choices: \u2026 you are reckless to the fact that the money is proceeds of crime|\u2026 you are negligent to the fact that the money is proceeds of crime|\u2026 you intend for the money to become an instrument of crime|All the above

question.name: Question 14
question.correctans: These are blacklisted assets or assets owned by blacklisted people and organisations
question.choices: These are blacklisted debts that occurred as a result of terrorist activity|These are blacklisted assets, however, they can be used or dealt with by approval of the AUSTRAC CEO|These are blacklisted assets or assets owned by blacklisted people and organisations|These are assets that get intercepted when overseas terrorist organisations try to enter them into Australia

question.name: Question 15
question.correctans: It is an offence to receive, possess, conceal or dispose of money if it is reasonable to expect that the money is proceeds of crime
question.choices: Only individuals can be held liable for terrorism financing offences|Only corporations can be held liable for terrorism financing offences|Penalties for money laundering offences only apply if terrorist financing actually took place|It is an offence to receive, possess, conceal or dispose of money if it is reasonable to expect that the money is proceeds of crime
